turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Hibiscus (restaurant).
turn.1: What did the menu at Hibiscus consist of?
turn.2: The first part was roasted suckling pig served with sea urchin, kohlrabi and a fondant of sweet potato.
turn.4: The second, inspired by his daughter, featured a sausage roll with a salad and a truffle dressing.
turn.5: Did they have any other unique foods?
turn.6: Other dishes have included roast chicken with an onion fondue and licorice, and desserts include a chocolate tart served with basil ice cream.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Bosi uses molecular gastronomy techniques, such as in the process for making a Savoy cabbage purée, in which the cabbage is freeze dried into a powder and then reconstituted, but he prefers only to enhance the flavours of individual ingredients rather than changing those flavours by using unusual techniques.
turn.9: What did the public think of the restaurant?
turn.10: Jay Rayner reviewed the restaurant for "The Observer" after Hibiscus moved from Ludlow to London, his first time at the restaurant.
turn.11: What did he have to say?
turn.12: While stating that elements of the meal were "very clever indeed", such as foie gras ice cream and a sausage roll he described as a "colossus", he described the desserts as a "disappointment", calling an olive oil parfait a "gloopy mess".
